meanings.definition: A deep hole or pit in a road surface caused by wear or weathering.
meanings.sent1: The road crew filled the potholes with fresh asphalt.
meanings.sent2: Be careful driving on this street; there are many potholes.
meanings.sent3: Why did the potholes refuse to play cards? They always fold!
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a road full of potholes, bumpy and uneven.
meanings.sent5: The potholes on the street were so deep, they could swallow a small car.

meanings.definition: A pit or hole in a rock formation.
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully navigated around the potholes in the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent2: The potholes in the cliff were evidence of ancient erosion.
meanings.sent3: Why did the little pebble refuse to fall into the potholes? It was too scared!
meanings.sent4: The potholes in the mountain looked like giant mouths waiting to swallow anything that came near.
meanings.sent5: The potholes in the cave were so dark and deep, they seemed bottomless.
